# Get rid of outliers in the age and income columns
# Function to identify the outliers
outlier_detect <- function(x) {

  Q1 <- quantile(x, probs=.25)
  Q3 <- quantile(x, probs=.75)
  iqr = Q3-Q1

 upper_limit = Q3 + (iqr*1.5)
 lower_limit = Q1 - (iqr*1.5)

 x > upper_limit | x < lower_limit
}
# Function to remove the outliers
rm_outliers <- function(df, cols = names(df)) {
  for (col in cols) {
    df_new <- df[!outlier_detect(df[[col]]),]
  }
  return(df_new)
}
# Remove the outliers from the columns age and income
df_profiles <- rm_outliers(df_profiles, c('age', 'income'))
# remove duplicate rows from dataset
df_profiles <- df_profiles[!duplicated(df_profiles), ]
# Get the new dimension
dim(df_profiles)
```{r}

```
# Standardize the location column to make sure all values are the same by making them uppercase
df_profiles$location <- toupper(df_profiles$location)
df_latLong$location <- toupper(df_latLong$location)

# Merge the profiles data set with the df_latlon data set to get the latitude and longitude
df_profiles <- left_join(df_profiles, df_latLong, by ='location')
```{r}

```
# Impute the state using the location column for df_address. Then merge the column with df_profiles
# Return the indexes where the State is null and populate the state column the same as above
na_indxes_st <- which(is.na(df_address$state))
#Adding to be pushed
for (indx in na_indxes_st){
  loc_split <- strsplit(str_to_title(df_address$location[indx]), split=", ")
  df_address$state[indx] <- loc_split[[1]][2]
}
# Create a subset of the df_adress that only includes the location and state to merge with df_profiles
df_state <- subset(df_address, select = c(location, state))
# Make Location and state all uppercase in df_address
df_state$state <- toupper(df_state$state)
df_state$location <- toupper(df_state$location)

# Merge the profiles data set with the df_state data set to get the state
df_profiles <- left_join(df_profiles, df_state, by ='location')
